content: Thank you all a lot for your positive comments. It was my first contribution and I will now try to understand the sdk in order to submit an easy/medium puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The problem is simple but with lots of little things to get tripped up by and learn from like 0 cuts being high, iterating over the rows rather than the cuts, and how to represent the the key handle's static data. 
Once you have the right model for how to approach the problem though it's an easy solve and has a lot of optimization potential by using advanced language features that the slower racers can learn from.
Very fun concept and a fantastic clash of code problem.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really cool,  the handle part  is a great idea too
Really cool,  the handle part  is a great idea too

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The contribution is very fun, teaches using lists, thinking in two dimensions and practising loops
Really cool, did it for fun and missed the handle part at first. Really cool you added it as it would be way easier without it

Goal section:
* Please specify that the key is represented using the character {{*}}, and the length of the handle is always {{4}}. Also, the bits are on the left and the handle is on the right, and the two parts are joined with {{**}}.

Input section:
* Please rewrite Line 1 description as "An integer [[width]] for the key width".
* Please rewrite Line 2 description as "A string [[specs]] for the key bitting depths from left to right, each character being a digit representing the bitting depth".

Output section:
* Please delete "following".

Constraints section:
* Please change the constraint as "4 ≤ [[width]] ≤ 10". The change is required because the representation of the key bitting depths will not work if width is greater than 10 (some bitting depths may have to be represented by 2-digit numbers).

Optional:
* In CG, height usually refers to the number of lines/rows while width usually refers to the number of columns. But you have used [[width]] to refer to the number of lines/rows, so it's a bit confusing to me. Not a big issue though, I guess.
* In CG, usually when the inputs are a series of integers, they will be given as space-separated integers (e.g. 0 1 3 1) instead of a continuous string (e.g. 0131). Suggest you to change to that, but I guess it is still ok if you choose not to change it.
Thanks a lot. This is very relevant feedback.

Thank you for making the changes! A few more comments on the current revised version:

Goal section
* ...same height as the key "height" instead of "bittings" (as the bittings are of various heights).
* Add a full-stop at the end.

Input section
* Rewrite Line 2 description as: A series of space-separated integers [[specs]] for the key bitting heights from left to right (now that the integers are space-separated, the description can be much more simplified)

Thanks!
